Gir.description: The Gir is a famous milk cattle breed of India. Native to the Gir hills and forests of Kathiawar. It is known for its tolerance to stress conditions and resistance to various tropical diseases.
Gir.food_habits: Grazing on natural pastures, requires balanced diet for high milk yield. Thrives on green fodder like maize, sorghum, and lucerne.
Gir.habitat: Gujarat, India. Adapted to tropical heat. Can survive effectively in warm climates.
Gir.characteristics: Distinctive convex forehead, long pendulous ears, and horns that curve back and up. Coat color varies from red to spotted white.

Sahiwal.description: Sahiwal is considered one of the best milch cattle breeds of India. It has the highest milk yield among Zebu breeds and shows strong tick resistance.
Sahiwal.food_habits: Green fodder, dry fodder, and concentrates. Requires a high-energy diet during lactation.
Sahiwal.habitat: Punjab, Rajasthan, and Haryana. Originally from the Montgomery district (now in Pakistan).
Sahiwal.characteristics: Reddish dun color, massive hump, loose skin, calm temperament; locally called 'Lola'.

Red Sindhi.description: Red Sindhi is a renowned heat-tolerant dairy cattle breed. It is genetically close to Sahiwal but slightly smaller in build.
Red Sindhi.food_habits: Adaptable to various feeds; prefers grazing but performs well in semi-intensive dairy systems.
Red Sindhi.habitat: Originally from Sindh, now widespread across India and tropical countries.
Red Sindhi.characteristics: Deep red body color with compact frame; males show darker shading on shoulders and hump.

Murrah.description: Murrah is the most important buffalo breed for milk production and is often referred to as the 'Black Gold' of India.
Murrah.food_habits: Requires rich green fodder and protein concentrates. Needs regular access to water for wallowing.
Murrah.habitat: Haryana, Punjab, and Delhi; thrives in river-belt regions and humid climates.
Murrah.characteristics: Jet-black coat, compact body, and tightly curled spiral horns, a defining breed trait.
Murrah.milk_yield: 1800 - 2500 kg per lactation (higher under good management)

Jaffarabadi.description: Jaffarabadi is one of the heaviest and most powerful buffalo breeds of India, native to the Gir forest region.
Jaffarabadi.food_habits: Heavy feeder; requires nutrient-dense fodder and cannot sustain well on poor grazing lands.
Jaffarabadi.habitat: Gujarat, especially coastal and forest adjoining regions.
Jaffarabadi.characteristics: Very large head, broad face, and wide flat horns that droop outward and curve upward at the tips.
